job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: I was on a great unit with a great manager & coworkers, decent staffing ratio (1:3-4). New grad rate pretty standard for area. My unit was pretty well staffed so easy to take time off. Good resources - IV team, transport, lab, rapid team pretty accessible. Decent provider-nurse communication (oncology)
cons: Pulling staff from staffed units, causing us to be below minimum staffing. When other departments drop the ball it falls onto nurse. Visitor policy very frustrating for patients/families (current 2 at time, 4 total). Other roles in hospital can be unprofessional / unsafe in patient care.(EVS is always on their cell phones and eating while cleaning patient rooms)

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I really enjoyed working in Froedtert surgery back in 2018-2019. Despite how big the department is (over 45 ORs if I remember correctly), I felt very at ease as a brand new tech. The doctors, nurses, and CSTs are all very patient and encourage questions and curiosity.
cons: The hospital system has gotten too big to accommodate individual needs and requests. If you become sick and need time off, you might as well quit. The HR department is a bureaucratic nightmare with low empathy.

review_title: Good culture but broader market strategy is inflexible for the individual physician
pros: Overall a positive culture, leadership is not isolated and very accessible for meetings to discuss any concerns. At the time, the financial position was very strong and growth was rampant and exciting. A special place to practice medicine.
cons: Although leadership was accessible and the system is excellent from a medicine sense, when it came to a broader market strategy and my role, they were inflexible. The strategy at the time was to flood the market with appointment space for patients, even when it meant diluting the patient base and thus impacting the individual physician's bottom line. In other words, the plan was to hire more physicians than the demographics could support - the result: few patients per physician. I left as a result and my replacement left after about 2 years of trying to build.

review_title: decent pay; very little control over schedule, policies, staffing HR problems

pros: good benefits, coworkers, 401k with match, good healthcare
cons: depending on unit but type of patient population

pros: Friendly staff, health and dental benefits,
cons: Old computer systems, non flexible scheduling

review_title: Overall, not a bad place to work
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Froedtert offers good benefits, comparable pay

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician I (MLT) in Milwaukee, WI
pros: It’s a Fine place to work
cons: My downside is working in general

pros: Great co-workers and resources to promote career growth
cons: Management and administration are very fixated on numbers

pros: Good place with good coworkers and clean
cons: Honestly not that much to affect work but sometimes it can be busy i guess it’s said already cause it’s a hospital

review_title: Good place to work. Froedtert could make a couple minor changes to greatly improve the work environment.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Good salary (although I hear Aurora is much better---would be nice to be higher than our competition), good work environment, (Woodland Prime), good management and directors, can voice opinions to them during rounding, always striving to improve, good events within like blood drives, fitness classes, etc. Continuing education, great cafeteria, good group of friendly and nice co-workers through out the whole building.
cons: HR/internal application process needs to improve, won't allow "fun" days or casual Fridays, (other locations do like the hospitals) open Christmas Eve New Years Eve, day after Thanksgiving, process with raises isn't very fair-it's extremely hard to get past the first tier (most people only meet that first level where you get the smallest raise). It also seems that positions often get cut. Scary!

review_title: Great place to begin a future
job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Milwaukee, WI
pros: High minimum wage pay rate
cons: There are no known cons

pros: Being able to help patients
cons: Management does not care. There are no "patients" only "customers"

job_title: Clinical Liaison in West Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great Culture and great team work.
cons: It is a slow moving interview process

pros: They have flexible work schedules
cons: some weekends may be required

job_title: Computer Operations Technician in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Healthcare field provides job security

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Milwaukee, WI

pros: Flexible hours work from home

job_title: Health Coach in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros:
Coworkers and managers were wonderful to work with. 
Well paid
cons: Inconsistent schedule from week to week.

pros: Good communication! Great Teamwork and support

Physical Job

review_title: Could be better, could be worse.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The pay has improved over the years and there is job security.

pros: Glassdoor is glassdoor is a good

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Milwaukee, WI

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Menomonee Falls, WI

review_title: An excellent-ish place to work and learn
pros: Level 1 Trauma teaching hospital, lots of support for staff, MAGNET
cons: very little autonomy for RNs

job_title: Executive Director Tech in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Met some awesome nurses and lifelong friends
cons: Management, turnover rate, tech abuse

job_title: New Patient Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Trauma 1 center, good benefits, quality training.
cons: Underpaid, always having staffing issues, high turnaround.

job_title: Regional Director of Operations in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Growing company, pay, patient centric
cons: lack of professional growth, stressful work

job_title: Systems Analyst in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Beautiful office space, and a great group of people (personally) throughout the organization.
cons: Pretty much everything that isn't office space and people (on a personal level). The worst of it is how they choose to staff IT. There are way too many people brought over from the clinical side to take on IT and informatics jobs. These people tend to not think logically, lack forethought and lack an eye for building out scalable, efficient systems. That's not to say that some of these clinical people don't have this ability, they do, it's just most don't.  Of those that do, they succeed in CI/IT roles in spite of their clinical backgrounds, not because of it.

review_title: Good organization on the way to being great!
pros: Good company to work for.  It offers a decent salary, has good core values, and is relatively stable.     A lot of changes are going on in healthcare and this company strives to stay at the forefront.  Forward thinking leaders permeate the organization in most departments.  Good strong senior leadership. Excellent benefit (health and wellness) programs.
cons: Challenging to move up through the ranks regardless of experience and background.  Employee base not as diverse (representative) as the service area it supports.  Education tuition assistance in the middle of the road.

job_title: I T Manager in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Benefits are on par with the industry.  Some very good staff in IT.
cons: Some in management were promoted for political reasons, or cronyism which has caused IT to be in disarray.  For exmample one of these top level directors stopped the ITIL implementation in progress.  Many frontline managers do not understand the technical duties of their staff.  HR treats IT staff as though we are nursing staff.

pros: Good benefits, workplace clinic, patient care is a priority. Building relationships with your patients.
cons: The clinic I worked at had no vision for change I worked there for only a few months. My "teammates" did not really want to work together I was placed in an environment where there was favoritism, I was humiliated in front of patients and other staff by my coworker. Management did not do what a manager I felt should have done. Instead talked to the entire clinic about the issue. This person ran the clinic, and not the manager which was sad. My experience was unethical it did not follow the values of what the company stands for and the support they say they will give you as an employee. Parking is just another joke for employees that have to be shuttled.

review_title: Serious Executive Leadership problems in IT
job_title: Group Leader in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: World class patient care, steady pay increases, interesting work.  Decent benefits, but could be better.
cons: CIO has cleaned house and hired leadership team who subscribe to her bullying, tyrannical, micro-management style of leadership.  Saw 2 employees crying in the restrooms last week after being a meeting with CIO. Has become fear-based, blaming culture.  In all IT meetings gives insincere praise.  Privately criticizes  individuals and teams with demeaning unprofessional language.  Everyone is walking on eggshells around CIO and CTO.  Fear-based environment, very management top-heavy,does not value or even allow employees to be part of the solution.

review_title: Over worked, understaffed, under valued for level of education and experience
pros: Large healthcare facility, always with a position to fill. The Epilepsy doctors are top notch and respect a well-trained and educated technologist. Monthly CEU opportunities. Rare on call hours due to 24 hr double coverage. Multiple modalities
cons: Employs techs with little to no education or experience for high wages. Management has no regard to valuing credentials. Double digit VEEG machines. Department is in terrible condition with mismatched carpet and signs hanging off walls. Need new coat of paint. Patients complain about appearance of the lab.

pros: Management for the most part is flexible to work with. Great coworkers.
cons: Very strict punch in policy even if there is a major snow storm. No exceptions. You will be held accountable and it will show up in your review. Normally, I do not have an issue getting to work on time. Last winter I received an email regarding being late by 3 minutes. When I explained that the roads were not plowed and icy, I was told it didn't matter.

review_title: Runaway as fast as you can
job_title: Cancer Center Tech in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Staff other than management, amazing. Will do anything for their patients.
cons:
Management too top heavy. (A manager, a staff nurse, 2  schedulers, and acoordinator.) Scheduling should not be an issue,but everyday there was either overtime or low census.  Then they wonder why they cant retain employees. They either burn them out or they do not get their 40 hrs. People need work life balance.  
The staff that bends over backwards for department, works min. 20 hrs OT when people quit ends up getting pushed around when they finally do get fully staffed. Changes their schedule with no warning. 
A lot of reverse discrimination in action.

review_title: Good place to work, but could use improvements
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros:
Friendly Environment
Promotes strong community involvement
Stresses safety first for both staff and patients.
Health, Dental, and Vision benefits are very good
Employees are friendly and helpful
Some fringe benefits are nice, like dealership and AAA discounts
cons:
Pay is below average in IT
Some benefits are on hold or possibly eliminated, like tuition reimbursement for non-clinical studies.
Promotions are done through attrition, and usually have little salary increase.

pros: Froedtert is conscious and considerate of their employess, and when the economy took a downturn, they did everything they could to NOT lay off employee. They have done numerous cost saving measures to help with hiring more people as well as ensure yearly review raises. Most managers seem to be easy to talk to and friendly. Co-workers have a sense of comraderie and people genuinely care about the patients
cons: Pay seems low when looking at the cost of living and other goods.

pros: Working in an academic medical center is fantastic because of the ever interesting and unique patient cases that we see and ever expanding knowledge that we develop .  I am happy with the possibility of participating and conducting scientific research studies.  I like being able to have a sub-specialty even within my specific role as a clinical outpatient dietitian.  The clinical dietitian manager is flexible within reason to allow for position changes within the department- for example moving from inpatient to outpatient care.
cons: There is an ever increasing demand for patient care but often  not enough dietitians to be able to meet those needs.  Sometimes the physicians are not responsive to dietitian recommendations, which needless to say, can be aggravating.

pros: Finally got excellent leadership in IT. We have been waiting too long for change. Before the new CIO and the CTO arrived, there was no accountability of your work. People did whatever they wanted and the services were down 3-5 times a week. Now there is accountability and the older IT staff hates it. I love the new culture that the CIO and the CTO is bringing. If we want to grow, we need to hold IT accountable.
cons: People who have been at Froedtert too long and too lazy to change. We need more of the new blood.

review_title: Best Healthcare Company to work for
pros: Froedtert has the best benefits  and compensation in the area compared to other medical centers. It has flexible scheduling options. Froedtert also offers great education opportunities.
cons: Recently, benefits for vacation were cut. Management cited that "Obamacare" was a reason that employees had to take a cut in benefits in order to contain costs which is interesting since Froedtert now is doing better financially. Recently, a company was hired to improve efficiency and nursing jobs were not filled leaving the units painfully short. Interestingly, no management positions were cut or reassigned. Froedtert is exceptionally meeting heavy. Parking is oftentimes an issues. Management can be unapproachable. Unfortunately, it seems like Froedtert is becoming more like their competition and work conditions are getting worse.

review_title: This is a good place to work.
job_title: Patient Care Tech. in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Because you can learn a lot in the medical field and it is a teaching hospital.I have been here for about 3 years and i have meet a lot of positive people and just by watching them it makes me want to move further in my career.They encourage you to move on with your life i've had nurses and doctors be very encouraging so i've recently signed up for nursing school and i'm looking forward to starting very soon.I got my start in an nursing home then i moved on to doing home health but once i hit the hospital my whole life changed.
cons: overall i haven't had any.

pros: Flexible schedule, decent pay, patients appreciate what we do for them.
cons: Need more staff, longer hours than I would like, cliques and gossiping

job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
A great and very rewarding job.
Ability to develop specific skill set
cons:
Top down leadership.
Too many managers, not enough leaders.
Self-serving management and directors.
Managers  "leaders" favor and promote selected individuals.

job_title: Executive Director Compensation, Benefits & HRIS in Milwaukee, WI
pros: This organization has visionary leadership who understand the challenges posed by a changing industry  It is financially strong.  There is plenty of opportunity for career growth for those willing to change and continuously learn.
cons: This is a growing organization undergoing the kinds of changes necessary to be successful in a changing industry.  If you do not like change or the ambiguity that accompanies change, or if you are not flexible and willing to learn new skills, this may not be the organization for you.

pros: The Facility does  good job stressing the importance of advancing your  nursing education.
cons:
There are no compromises in your work schedule to be able to attend the classess.  A lot of nurses work nights so they can go to school early in the morning.  If you are unable to maintain your work schedule then you must go part-time.  
     After you have completed your degree, the facility does a poor job of helping nurses stay at the facility in a new capacity. 
     If you want to be hired as a nurse and not advance your career, this is the place for you

review_title: Non for profit, caring environment. Focus on patients.
job_title: Physical Therapy Technician in West Bend, WI
pros: Patient advocates, friendly co workers, meaningful work, learning environment and opportunities for advancement. Help pay for schooling. Median pay. Health, dental, vision, PTO
cons: Over years reduced benefits, still good but times have changed. The "extras" that made Froedtert feel like a family have mostly disappeared and while focus is still on patients, it feels more factory than family.

pros: This is a great organization.  The staff and leaders work hard to ensure that patients,  customers and other staff are treated with respect. I am very proud to work at Froedtert and hope to be for a long time.
cons: I don't have any cons at this time. There isn't a "petfect" position or company. Froedtert is growing and it may put more work on us but that is also a sign of thier strength as an organization.

review_title: Froedtert is a GREAT place to work!
pros: The 7/70 schedule is awesome...you can plan vacations years out if you want because you know every other week you have off.  There is no mandatory overtime and you are pretty much garanteed a lunch most days because you have another shift covering for you.  Many people who work at Froedtert are proud to work there...and it shows in their work and attitude big time.
cons: I think the compensation is average or a slight bit below average other hospitals in the area.

pros:
Decent benefits
Culture of improving patient care
cons: Horrible hiring process, out-sourced vendor terrible, knows nothing about company misrepresents which position is open, appears to use some algorithms to screen out applicants despite having a personal referral (someone who already works in same job and believed I was qualified.  Took 4 months to get an interview, rejected 3 times before hiring manager over-ruled HR.

job_title: Senior Clinical Data Analyst in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Froedtert & the Medical College of Wisconsin believes in diversity and empowering their employees to work to the best.  They don't just pay lip service to these values - they actually do it.  They value teamwork and doing the best in the community and they follow thru.  I love working there and would highly recommend it to anyone.
cons: It's a large company and IT has issues with getting people access - it's a pain, but it happens everywhere.

review_title: Only lasted a few months ... too big, too impersonal.
pros: Great reputation for patient care.
cons: At Froedtert Hospital, employees must park quite a distance away from the building, then walk to/from the hospital. There is no shuttle bus.  The crossing guard takes his life in his hands every day with all the traffic, and employees often take a short cut and cross the busy street without the crossing guard to save time.  Very dangerous.

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Patient centered provides a great service to the community and high quality. Good benefits.
cons: Standards of work life balance not consistent across departments. Very little a subordinate employee can do if you there are issues at the level of your director.  It really depends on your manager. Yearly review process is a total chore with very little merit rewarded.

review_title: 17 years of 7/70 scheduling is pure Heaven!
pros: 7/70 scheduling, fair pay, no mandatory overtime, 29 weeks of work a year, lots of opportunity, better than average tuition reimbursement, cutting edge technology and up-to-date equipment.
cons: Lots of politics, but it's a big place and it's expected, communication issues, slow computer system, rapid and continuous changes to just about everything..building, technology makes it hard to keep up, convoluted self-evaluations.

review_title: A good healthcare system  on its way to becoming great!
pros: Good pay.  Good development opportunities. Good job security for healthcare related occupations.
cons: Senior leadership a little disconnected from mainstream staff.  Career progression structure/program for employees does not exist.  Very slow to change.

review_title: Corporate stooges who play politics all day long and have their head up the VP's azz
pros: Great medical facility with great doctors and medical technology.
cons: Hours were really long. Infrastructure problem. No support or proper onboarding at all from director or his stooge of a senior manager.  Paid lip service and lied about numerous things. Very superficial.

review_title: A good hospital with some quality leadership
pros: A good organization overall, a safe place to work for those who are comfortable runinng the same projects over and over for years.
cons: IT management is vindictive and not welcoming of new ideas.  They hold grudges against those who they see as threatening or innovative.  Only supportive of those who walk the party line 100% of the time.

review_title: Good place to work with a few issues typical of Corporate America
pros: The overwhelming majority of staff care about their jobs and understand that patient care is what drives the organization. The organization offers competitive pay and benefits and a good working environment.
cons: Can be very top-down style of management, where administrative decisions must be run up the chain of command to people who are less knowledgeable about an issue. Politics plays a heavy role in decision-making.

pros: I have never been more impressed with a healthcare system, and I've worked with many. The leadership from the CEO on down are committed to success and their employees. Your opportunities here are endless.
cons: Well, parking. It's a testament to the system that they are continuing to grow despite a rocky healthcare environment. Growth has challenges however, and parking for all of the staff is a big one!

review_title: Consultants are looked upon as more valuable than full time staff.
pros: Company is growing throughout southeast WI and expanding into areas outside the hospital setting.
cons: Hiring a lot of consultants shows current employees they are not valuable.  HR going through a transformation and appears to not care for the impact it has on current HR staff.

pros: Work for a level 1 trauma center
cons: Management is very poor here. Nurse managers have little training and treat their staff terribly. If they want you gone, they will create a reason, pit everyone against you, and make you feel shunned and hunted until you leave or are fired for some made up reason. And guess what, you say anything or do anything about it because HR is NOT on your side and if you do try to stand up for yourself or your peers, YOU will be next.

pros: Good benefits. Froedtert tries hard, has  good intentions. Flexible scheduling options. Froedtert saves a lot of lives,working there gives one a sense of doing good.
cons: Issues not addressed.  Certain employees not held to the high standards as others. Froedtert management seems to have  "Changed", don't seem to care about loyal employees.

pros: Decent pay and profit sharing plan
cons: Management and Administration - they are not honest with their employees and will pass the buck back and forth between them because nobody wants to be honest about who made a mistake.  Check your time card every pay period because management will change it without notifying you even though this is illegal..  Rules are not made straight across the board; they pick and choose who gets away with breaking policies and who doesn't.  They tend to hire younger people, 25 and below, who do not have decent work ethics and are not team players.  They will make verbal agreements and not follow them; then they'll write you up for corrective action.

pros: Froedtert hospital is a good quality health care facility.  The salary is quite competitive.  Many wonderful employees have a team spirit.
cons: Some higher end administrators are beyond their level of professional responsibilities & capabilities.  Thus making it a very stressful environment to work in everyday.

pros: Stability and advancement a great pluses with a company of this size. The team I work with is great and we share ideas openly. Compensation is strong.
cons: Sometimes management is distant to the point it creates a lot of questions.  Retention should be focused on more. Questions that are brought up can take forever to receive responses on. Better flow of information would make all feel more engaged.

job_title: Applications Analyst in West Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great teams that are passionate about patient care. People are willing to explain how things work or should so the best functionality is possible.
cons: Issues with project management. Everyone has an opinion but no clear ways to direct issues to resolve. Lack of point people for projects and strapped for resources to complete the jobs in a acceptable time frame.

job_title: Leave Specialist in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Great health insurance coverage, CEO is current with market trends, fast paced environment, large organization that is constantly growing, tattoos can be visible at work
cons: No flexible work schedule, no ability to work from home, have to use vacation time for maternity leave, departments do not work well with each other, strict dress code

review_title: Good culture and for the most part I like the job.
pros: Staff and working/lif balence is great.
cons: You have to go to the 'company shop' for health care or you are out of network.  Children's hospital is in network but if you have a GP that works for another systeem your out of luck.

review_title: Good company, strong leadership, not the highest paying but best job security of any health provider in SE Wi.
pros: Job security. Strong leadership. Great communication for upper management down. Always felt like we were on the leading edge of technology in the area.
cons: Continued growth at off site clinics meant that in radiology you could be at 3 different locations in a week. Also company was always crying poor but the cranes and buildings keep going up. Pay is lower compared to competitors.

pros: Staff strives to give patient quality care. for the most part, patients are very happy with the care received. Team work is great.
cons: Pay is competitive but lower than the area. Management listens to staff ideas but does not take action or provide follow up.

pros: I work independently in my clinic setting, my ideas, suggestions are always considered.  Knowledgable co-workers makes for a strong health care team.
cons: It is IMPOSSIBLE to get fired! Employees that have crossed many lines such as verbal abuse, safety and bullying are all still employed because Froedert insists on rehabing these individuals which in most cases is a mistake.

review_title: NOT like all the other big health systems....
pros: Excellent focus on patient care, sound fiscal practices, respectable pay/benefits, appear to value their employees
cons: competition/growing pains, (at the time) change in management was rather shaky, fierce competition from other major systems compel them to cut corners.

pros:
Yes, I have a job while some people are filing for unemployment during this COVID-19 crisis, but I should be working from home since, by definition, my job description is considered non-essential.

Finally issued a face mask April 2, 2020 after working without any PPE for the last couple weeks.
cons: This organization might lose good employees when this is all said and done and it’s sad that they probably don’t even care. CHW and MCW handled things swiftly and way better, so not sure why the memo was not received by their campus neighbors.

job_title: Patient Registration Representative in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good beneifits, and the work you do is always rewarding
cons: Poor management they take sides, show favoritism, don't acknowladge good workers, doesn't ask for inputs from their team, added new duties with improper training, inconsiderate with life work balance, wanted to see workers fail, poorly staffed, and a high turn out rate.

pros: Rewarding work, I enjoy the work.
cons:
Overworked and underpaid
Changing work hours / shift.
Not enough employee parking need to take shuttle from offsite parking lot. 
To many chiefs and not enough Indians. 
No room for advancement.

pros: Teaching and Magnet Hospital which means lots of areas for growth, advanced equipment, teamwork, gain critical thinking skills
cons: Not as competitive with pay, staffing shortages because can’t keep up with the demands of the growing need for patient care

job_title: Human Resources Employment Generalist in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: Great mission, patient focused.   Excellent CEO and culture description is truly one of performance excellence
cons: HR leadership is assigned to specialities they are unexperienced in and without the knowledge of how the function works, they cant lead the team.  Very low morale

review_title: It is all about patient surveys and not patient care, patient surveys means more $$$ for the higher satisfied patients.
pros: Fair pay and benefits, good work schedule.
cons: Politics, politics, politics, and more worried about patient surveys for reimbursement then patient care. Too many chiefs and not enough Indians.Tend to favor certain employees over others.

pros: Dedicated team of nurses, techs and support staff
cons: Cathy Jacobson is out of touch with the organization.

pros: Keeps you informed about what is new and upcoming, good work environment, and company truly cares about you.
cons: Utilizing PTO can be a challenge since you need enough hours saved for holidays.  This can be a challenge if you have been ill or have an upcoming vacation planned when a holiday is right around the corner.

review_title: Very positive work environment.  Everyone is definitely patient-focused and willing to work on improvements.
pros: Positive work environment.  Have not experienced any hot-headed or temper tantrums.  Everyone is professional.
cons: Having to work in a hospital can be intimidating and scary at times.  Many organizational silos among departments make it difficult to implement standardized change across the hospital.

review_title: Over all great place to work
job_title: Pharmacy Informatics in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Upper leaders care about the patients and staff.    Thought leader in healthcare, and academic medicine.
cons: Some mid level managers that are ineffective are tolerated, and don't seem to be held accountable.

pros: High quality environment, good and intelligent people to work with.
cons: Changing jobs takes a long time in a large corporate setting. Floating means learning a lot of new settings and people, and what keeps them happy.

pros: Fast paced.  Many different duties which made for a quick work day.
cons: Although I loved my job, sometimes management wasn't great.  There was a lot of favoritism (and I was a favorite) and work flow was constantly changing.

pros: 1st shift and no weekends
cons: High turnover, a lot of talk and no action, micro managing

pros: They have great benefits and are making great strides to retain the best talent possible.
cons: Sometimes the size of the company means that you feel like you are just "another resource".

pros: Upper management is communicative and transparent. Good work culture on unit. Competitive pay. Teaching hospital, level 1 trauma center means you've got help when you need it. All employees received a cash bonus two years running.
cons: Busy floor, understaffed a lot of the time. Not enough parking for employees.

pros: Working part-time offers me work life balance. The company supports furthering education.
cons: Working at different locations can take some extra planning but it's not bad and mileage is reimbursed.

pros: Level I trauma center. Magnet hospital, good training, and supportive environment with a lot of teamwork. Units are very specialized.  Policies are clear.
cons: Work/life balance, there are many expected extracurricular activities (magnet related). Very busy, chaotic at times. Limited resources on certain floors.

pros: Great hours, decent benefits and PTO, self fulfilling to help others
cons: low pay, 0 room for growth, hard work is not noticed

review_title: Could be such a great place to work.
pros: That actual work here is good work, and decent way to make a living and career.
cons: Management is horrible, it is over managed to the point of frustration.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Milwaukee, WI
pros: 7/70  work life balance
cons:
Getting to big and not enough staff and like most hospitals nurses are top priorities 
We are the little people that do the most work and also no more being tech they made almost everyone a Cna again and top of pay scale went down to $17

job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Milwaukee, WI
pros: 3:1 patient: nurse ratio. Acute surgical, orthopedic, neurology, OBGYN, IR, and more specialties readily available. Plenty of ability to transfer and grow.
cons: Lots of turn over if staff seeking higher paid positions with the achievement of level I experience.

pros: There is not a pro to working for this company!
cons:
Management attacks good workers, they want high turn over at the company! 
HR does not want to see any good from a person or stand behind workers.

pros: Knowledgeable team, great work/life balance, above average health benefits, good organization culture
cons: Slightly below market pay, advancement can be limited

review_title: Best Healthcare System around with Wheaton Franciscan in a close 2nd place
pros:
Take care of their employees and value staff concerns
Adequate Staffing!!!
Great teamwork among staff
cons:
Very large facility, easy to get lost in.
Pay is less than most other systems in the area

pros: Magnet focus, shared governance,  quality improvement projects, research, teaching hospital
cons: Not appreciated, not paid enough or good enough benefits, not recognized

pros: Great coworkers, mostly flexible hours.  Nice to be able to work in different modalities..... Gained a lot of new experience here.
cons: Hours can be long, sometimes upper management says that they are interested in your input, but then no changes are made.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in New Berlin, WI
pros: Large company with great benefits
cons: expect you to do your job plus everyone else's too

job_title: Senior Clinical Data Analyst in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Excellent pay and benefits. Responsive leadership. One of the top places to work in Milwaukee.  Growth opportunities
cons: It's like every other job you ever had - it moves like an Aircraft carrier.  Change is slow.  That's what happens at large places.

job_title: Critical Care Technician in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: The ability to be super part time while in school
cons: The work environment was awful, people were backstabbing, and if you didn't "fit in" with the floor, they would bully you out. Manager also screamed at me for something that I didn't even work that day, and would not listen to me. I loved the ICU, but I was bullied into quitting.

review_title: Froedtert Hospital is a great place to work and grow.
pros: A decent benefits package.  Nursing is is huge and there's advancement.
cons: Very fast paced.  Depending on the department, the salary range can be lower than other hospitals in the area.

job_title: Systems Education Coordinator in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros:
Great community of professionals to work with. 
Value their employees and promote from within is always priority. 
Professional development opportunities are readily available.
cons: Projects tend to be kicked off and training is not involved from beginning. There are improvements being made.

job_title: Med Rec Tech in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: None at all that I can think of
cons: Treat their staff like crap. Most of the depts are short staffed and people are overworked. If you can't get your work done then you get threatened. They don't see any thing wrong with people working off the clock or not taking lunch/ breaks. It's like  working in  sweat shop conditions.

job_title: Office Assistant in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros:
Outstanding manager
Opportunities for advancement 
Positive work environment 
Recognition for a job well done
Even more opportunities since Froedtert’s alignment with the Medical College of Wisconsin
cons: Can be “cliquey” depending upon the department

job_title: Systems Engineer in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: CIO and CTO with vision. CIO has Epic background and understand how things should work
cons: Tough to change the culture but the new leadership is trying hard to make things better

pros: Constantly progressive. The institution as a whole is extremely interested in advancing practice
cons: Unclear direction - this is due to changes in management. Unclear if new leaders are groomed to be effective leaders.

pros: offers tuition reimbursement, growing hospital, expanding, room for growth
cons: parking isn't good, benefits package could be better, bonuses could be more regular

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Dynamic working environment in an educational institution
cons: Working in a large institution can be daunting at times because it can feel like you're just a cog in the machine but I honestly don't feel that way very often working at Froedtert.

review_title: my experience has been a long journey
pros: tuition reimbursement and the number one trauma hospital in Wisconsin.
cons: I think there is no opportunity for advancement in the company.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Menomonee Falls, WI
pros: Exceptionally strong focus on patient care and all aspects. The organization truly has the best patient care as its core focus.
cons: Very prescriptive in how to execute.

pros: Good work schedule, benefits, and great co workers.
